Name: FORMAT_VERSION
Description: This value is incremented when changes are made to the eeprom format

Name: SYSID_THISMAV
Description: Allows setting an individual MAVLink system id for this vehicle to distinguish it from others on the same network

Name: SYSID_MYGCS
Description: Allows restricting radio overrides to only come from my ground station

Name: PILOT_THR_FILT
Description: Throttle filter cutoff (Hz) - active whenever altitude control is inactive - 0 to disable

Name: PILOT_TKOFF_ALT
Description: Altitude that altitude control modes will climb to when a takeoff is triggered with the throttle stick.

Name: PILOT_THR_BHV
Description: Bitmask containing various throttle stick options. TX with sprung throttle can set PILOT_THR_BHV to "1" so motor feedback when landed starts from mid-stick instead of bottom of stick.

Name: TELEM_DELAY
Description: The amount of time (in seconds) to delay radio telemetry to prevent an Xbee bricking on power up

Name: GCS_PID_MASK
Description: bitmask of PIDs to send MAVLink PID_TUNING messages for

Name: RTL_ALT
Description: The minimum alt above home the vehicle will climb to before returning.  If the vehicle is flying higher than this value it will return at its current altitude.

Name: RTL_CONE_SLOPE
Description: Defines a cone above home which determines maximum climb

Name: RTL_SPEED
Description: Defines the speed in cm/s which the aircraft will attempt to maintain horizontally while flying home. If this is set to zero, WPNAV_SPEED will be used instead.

Name: RTL_ALT_FINAL
Description: This is the altitude the vehicle will move to as the final stage of Returning to Launch or after completing a mission.  Set to zero to land.

Name: RTL_CLIMB_MIN
Description: The vehicle will climb this many cm during the initial climb portion of the RTL

Name: RTL_LOIT_TIME
Description: Time (in milliseconds) to loiter above home before beginning final descent

Name: RTL_ALT_TYPE
Description: RTL altitude type.  Set to 1 for Terrain following during RTL and then set WPNAV_RFND_USE=1 to use rangefinder or WPNAV_RFND_USE=0 to use Terrain database

Name: FS_GCS_ENABLE
Description: Controls whether failsafe will be invoked (and what action to take) when connection with Ground station is lost for at least 5 seconds. See FS_OPTIONS param for additional actions, or for cases allowing Mission continuation, when GCS failsafe is enabled.

Name: GPS_HDOP_GOOD
Description: GPS Hdop value at or below this value represent a good position.  Used for pre-arm checks

Name: SUPER_SIMPLE
Description: Bitmask to enable Super Simple mode for some flight modes. Setting this to Disabled(0) will disable Super Simple Mode. The bitmask is for flight mode switch positions

Name: WP_YAW_BEHAVIOR
Description: Determines how the autopilot controls the yaw during missions and RTL

Name: LAND_SPEED
Description: The descent speed for the final stage of landing in cm/s

Name: LAND_SPEED_HIGH
Description: The descent speed for the first stage of landing in cm/s. If this is zero then WPNAV_SPEED_DN is used

Name: PILOT_SPEED_UP
Description: The maximum vertical ascending velocity the pilot may request in cm/s

Name: PILOT_ACCEL_Z
Description: The vertical acceleration used when pilot is controlling the altitude

Name: FS_THR_ENABLE
Description: The throttle failsafe allows you to configure a software failsafe activated by a setting on the throttle input channel

Name: FS_THR_VALUE
Description: The PWM level in microseconds on channel 3 below which throttle failsafe triggers

Name: THR_DZ
Description: The deadzone above and below mid throttle in PWM microseconds. Used in AltHold, Loiter, PosHold flight modes

Name: FLTMODE1
Description: Flight mode when pwm of Flightmode channel(FLTMODE_CH) is <= 1230

Name: FLTMODE2
Description: Flight mode when pwm of Flightmode channel(FLTMODE_CH) is >1230, <= 1360

Name: FLTMODE3
Description: Flight mode when pwm of Flightmode channel(FLTMODE_CH) is >1360, <= 1490

Name: FLTMODE4
Description: Flight mode when pwm of Flightmode channel(FLTMODE_CH) is >1490, <= 1620

Name: FLTMODE5
Description: Flight mode when pwm of Flightmode channel(FLTMODE_CH) is >1620, <= 1749

Name: FLTMODE6
Description: Flight mode when pwm of Flightmode channel(FLTMODE_CH) is >=1750

Name: FLTMODE_CH
Description: RC Channel to use for flight mode control

Name: INITIAL_MODE
Description: This selects the mode to start in on boot. This is useful for when you want to start in AUTO mode on boot without a receiver.

Name: SIMPLE
Description: Bitmask which holds which flight modes use simple heading mode (eg bit 0 = 1 means Flight Mode 0 uses simple mode). The bitmask is for flightmode switch positions.

Name: LOG_BITMASK
Description: 4 byte bitmap of log types to enable

Name: ESC_CALIBRATION
Description: Controls whether ArduCopter will enter ESC calibration on the next restart.  Do not adjust this parameter manually.

Name: TUNE
Description: Controls which parameters (normally PID gains) are being tuned with transmitter's channel 6 knob

Name: FRAME_TYPE
Description: Controls motor mixing for multicopters.  Not used for Tri or Traditional Helicopters.

Name: DISARM_DELAY
Description: Delay before automatic disarm in seconds. A value of zero disables auto disarm.

Name: ANGLE_MAX
Description: Maximum lean angle in all flight modes

Name: PHLD_BRAKE_RATE
Description: PosHold flight mode's rotation rate during braking in deg/sec

Name: PHLD_BRAKE_ANGLE
Description: PosHold flight mode's max lean angle during braking in centi-degrees

Name: LAND_REPOSITION
Description: Enables user input during LAND mode, the landing phase of RTL, and auto mode landings.

Name: FS_EKF_ACTION
Description: Controls the action that will be taken when an EKF failsafe is invoked

Name: FS_EKF_THRESH
Description: Allows setting the maximum acceptable compass and velocity variance

Name: FS_CRASH_CHECK
Description: This enables automatic crash checking. When enabled the motors will disarm if a crash is detected.

Name: RC_SPEED
Description: This is the speed in Hertz that your ESCs will receive updates

Name: ACRO_RP_P
Description: Converts pilot roll and pitch into a desired rate of rotation in ACRO and SPORT mode.  Higher values mean faster rate of rotation.

Name: ACRO_YAW_P
Description: Converts pilot yaw input into a desired rate of rotation.  Higher values mean faster rate of rotation.

Name: ACRO_BAL_ROLL
Description: rate at which roll angle returns to level in acro and sport mode.  A higher value causes the vehicle to return to level faster. For helicopter sets the decay rate of the virtual flybar in the roll axis. A higher value causes faster decay of desired to actual attitude.

Name: ACRO_BAL_PITCH
Description: rate at which pitch angle returns to level in acro and sport mode.  A higher value causes the vehicle to return to level faster. For helicopter sets the decay rate of the virtual flybar in the pitch axis. A higher value causes faster decay of desired to actual attitude.

Name: ACRO_TRAINER
Description: Type of trainer used in acro mode

Name: ACRO_RP_EXPO
Description: Acro roll/pitch Expo to allow faster rotation when stick at edges

Name: THROW_MOT_START
Description: Used by Throw mode. Controls whether motors will run at the speed set by MOT_SPIN_MIN or will be stopped when armed and waiting for the throw.

Name: WP_NAVALT_MIN
Description: This is the altitude in meters above which for navigation can begin. This applies in auto takeoff and auto landing.

Name: THROW_NEXTMODE
Description: Vehicle will switch to this mode after the throw is successfully completed.  Default is to stay in throw mode (18)

Name: THROW_TYPE
Description: Used by Throw mode. Specifies whether Copter is thrown upward or dropped.

Name: GND_EFFECT_COMP
Description: Ground Effect Compensation Enable/Disable

Name: DEV_OPTIONS
Description: Bitmask of developer options. The meanings of the bit fields in this parameter may vary at any time. Developers should check the source code for current meaning

Name: ACRO_Y_EXPO
Description: Acro yaw expo to allow faster rotation when stick at edges

Name: ACRO_THR_MID
Description: Acro Throttle Mid

Name: SYSID_ENFORCE
Description: This controls whether packets from other than the expected GCS system ID will be accepted

Name: FRAME_CLASS
Description: Controls major frame class for multicopter component

Name: PILOT_SPEED_DN
Description: The maximum vertical descending velocity the pilot may request in cm/s.  If 0 PILOT_SPEED_UP value is used.

Name: LAND_ALT_LOW
Description: Altitude during Landing at which vehicle slows to LAND_SPEED

Name: TUNE_MIN
Description: Minimum value that the parameter currently being tuned with the transmitter's channel 6 knob will be set to

Name: TUNE_MAX
Description: Maximum value that the parameter currently being tuned with the transmitter's channel 6 knob will be set to

Name: FS_VIBE_ENABLE
Description: This enables the vibration failsafe which will use modified altitude estimation and control during high vibrations

Name: FS_OPTIONS
Description: Bitmask of additional options for battery, radio, & GCS failsafes. 0 (default) disables all options.

Name: ACRO_OPTIONS
Description: A range of options that can be applied to change acro mode behaviour. Air-mode enables ATC_THR_MIX_MAN at all times (air-mode has no effect on helicopters). Rate Loop Only disables the use of angle stabilization and uses angular rate stabilization only.

Name: AUTO_OPTIONS
Description: A range of options that can be applied to change auto mode behaviour. Allow Arming allows the copter to be armed in Auto. Allow Takeoff Without Raising Throttle allows takeoff without the pilot having to raise the throttle. Ignore pilot yaw overrides the pilot's yaw stick being used while in auto.

Name: GUID_OPTIONS
Description: Options that can be applied to change guided mode behaviour

Name: FS_GCS_TIMEOUT
Description: Timeout before triggering the GCS failsafe

Name: RTL_OPTIONS
Description: Options that can be applied to change RTL mode behaviour

Name: FLIGHT_OPTIONS
Description: Flight mode specific options

Name: RNGFND_FILT
Description: Rangefinder filter to smooth distance.  Set to zero to disable filtering

Name: GUID_TIMEOUT
Description: Guided mode timeout after which vehicle will stop or return to level if no updates are received from caller. Only applicable during any combination of velocity, acceleration, angle control, and/or angular rate control

Name: ACRO_RP_RATE
Description: Acro mode maximum roll and pitch rate.  Higher values mean faster rate of rotation

Name: ACRO_Y_RATE
Description: Acro mode maximum yaw rate.  Higher value means faster rate of rotation

Name: PILOT_Y_RATE
Description: Pilot controlled yaw rate max.  Used in all pilot controlled modes except Acro

Name: PILOT_Y_EXPO
Description: Pilot controlled yaw expo to allow faster rotation when stick at edges

Name: SURFTRAK_MODE
Description: set which surface to track in surface tracking

Name: ADSB_TYPE
Description: Type of ADS-B hardware for ADSB-in and ADSB-out configuration and operation. If any type is selected then MAVLink based ADSB-in messages will always be enabled

Name: ADSB_LIST_MAX
Description: ADSB list size of nearest vehicles. Longer lists take longer to refresh with lower SRx_ADSB values.

Name: ADSB_LIST_RADIUS
Description: ADSB vehicle list radius filter. Vehicles detected outside this radius will be completely ignored. They will not show up in the SRx_ADSB stream to the GCS and will not be considered in any avoidance calculations. A value of 0 will disable this filter.

Name: ADSB_ICAO_ID
Description: ICAO_ID unique vehicle identification number of this aircraft. This is an integer limited to 24bits. If set to 0 then one will be randomly generated. If set to -1 then static information is not sent, transceiver is assumed pre-programmed.

Name: ADSB_EMIT_TYPE
Description: ADSB classification for the type of vehicle emitting the transponder signal. Default value is 14 (UAV).

Name: ADSB_LEN_WIDTH
Description: Aircraft length and width dimension options in Length and Width in meters. In most cases, use a value of 1 for smallest size.

Name: ADSB_OFFSET_LAT
Description: GPS antenna lateral offset. This describes the physical location offest from center of the GPS antenna on the aircraft.

Name: ADSB_OFFSET_LON
Description: GPS antenna longitudinal offset. This is usually set to 1, Applied By Sensor

Name: ADSB_RF_SELECT
Description: Transceiver RF selection for Rx enable and/or Tx enable. This only effects devices that can Tx and/or Rx. Rx-only devices should override this to always be Rx-only.

Name: ADSB_SQUAWK
Description: VFR squawk (Mode 3/A) code is a pre-programmed default code when the pilot is flying VFR and not in contact with ATC. In the USA, the VFR squawk code is octal 1200 (hex 0x280, decimal 640) and in most parts of Europe the VFR squawk code is octal 7000. If an invalid octal number is set then it will be reset to 1200.

Name: ADSB_RF_CAPABLE
Description: Describes your hardware RF In/Out capabilities.

Name: ADSB_LIST_ALT
Description: ADSB vehicle list altitude filter. Vehicles detected above this altitude will be completely ignored. They will not show up in the SRx_ADSB stream to the GCS and will not be considered in any avoidance calculations. A value of 0 will disable this filter.

Name: ADSB_ICAO_SPECL
Description: ICAO_ID of special vehicle that ignores ADSB_LIST_RADIUS and ADSB_LIST_ALT. The vehicle is always tracked. Use 0 to disable.

Name: ADSB_LOG
Description: 0: no logging, 1: log only special ID, 2:log all

Name: AFS_ENABLE
Description: This enables the advanced failsafe system. If this is set to zero (disable) then all the other AFS options have no effect

Name: AFS_MAN_PIN
Description: This sets a digital output pin to set high when in manual mode

Name: AFS_HB_PIN
Description: This sets a digital output pin which is cycled at 10Hz when termination is not activated. Note that if a FS_TERM_PIN is set then the heartbeat pin will continue to cycle at 10Hz when termination is activated, to allow the termination board to distinguish between autopilot crash and termination.

Name: AFS_WP_COMMS
Description: Waypoint number to navigate to on comms loss

Name: AFS_WP_GPS_LOSS
Description: Waypoint number to navigate to on GPS lock loss

Name: AFS_TERMINATE
Description: Can be set in flight to force termination of the heartbeat signal

Name: AFS_TERM_ACTION
Description: This can be used to force an action on flight termination. Normally this is handled by an external failsafe board, but you can setup ArduPilot to handle it here. Please consult the wiki for more information on the possible values of the parameter

Name: AFS_TERM_PIN
Description: This sets a digital output pin to set high on flight termination

Name: AFS_AMSL_LIMIT
Description: This sets the AMSL (above mean sea level) altitude limit. If the pressure altitude determined by QNH exceeds this limit then flight termination will be forced. Note that this limit is in meters, whereas pressure altitude limits are often quoted in feet. A value of zero disables the pressure altitude limit.

Name: AFS_AMSL_ERR_GPS
Description: This sets margin for error in GPS derived altitude limit. This error margin is only used if the barometer has failed. If the barometer fails then the GPS will be used to enforce the AMSL_LIMIT, but this margin will be subtracted from the AMSL_LIMIT first, to ensure that even with the given amount of GPS altitude error the pressure altitude is not breached. OBC users should set this to comply with their D2 safety case. A value of -1 will mean that barometer failure will lead to immediate termination.

Name: AFS_QNH_PRESSURE
Description: This sets the QNH pressure in millibars to be used for pressure altitude in the altitude limit. A value of zero disables the altitude limit.

Name: AFS_MAX_GPS_LOSS
Description: Maximum number of GPS loss events before the aircraft stops returning to mission on GPS recovery. Use zero to allow for any number of GPS loss events.

Name: AFS_MAX_COM_LOSS
Description: Maximum number of comms loss events before the aircraft stops returning to mission on comms recovery. Use zero to allow for any number of comms loss events.

Name: AFS_GEOFENCE
Description: This enables the geofence part of the AFS. Will only be in effect if AFS_ENABLE is also 1

Name: AFS_RC
Description: This enables the RC part of the AFS. Will only be in effect if AFS_ENABLE is also 1

Name: AFS_RC_MAN_ONLY
Description: If this parameter is set to 1, then an RC loss will only cause the plane to terminate in manual control modes. If it is 0, then the plane will terminate in any flight mode.

Name: AFS_DUAL_LOSS
Description: This enables the dual loss termination part of the AFS system. If this parameter is 1 and both GPS and the ground control station fail simultaneously, this will be considered a "dual loss" and cause termination.

Name: AFS_RC_FAIL_TIME
Description: This is the time in seconds in manual mode that failsafe termination will activate if RC input is lost. For the OBC rules this should be (1.5). Use 0 to disable.

Name: AFS_MAX_RANGE
Description: This is the maximum range of the vehicle in kilometers from first arming. If the vehicle goes beyond this range then the TERM_ACTION is performed. A value of zero disables this feature.

Name: AHRS_GPS_GAIN
Description: This controls how much to use the GPS to correct the attitude. This should never be set to zero for a plane as it would result in the plane losing control in turns. For a plane please use the default value of 1.0.

Name: AHRS_GPS_USE
Description: This controls whether to use dead-reckoning or GPS based navigation. If set to 0 then the GPS won't be used for navigation, and only dead reckoning will be used. A value of zero should never be used for normal flight. Currently this affects only the DCM-based AHRS: the EKF uses GPS according to its own parameters. A value of 2 means to use GPS for height as well as position - both in DCM estimation and when determining altitude-above-home.

Name: AHRS_YAW_P
Description: This controls the weight the compass or GPS has on the heading. A higher value means the heading will track the yaw source (GPS or compass) more rapidly.

Name: AHRS_RP_P
Description: This controls how fast the accelerometers correct the attitude

Name: AHRS_WIND_MAX
Description: This sets the maximum allowable difference between ground speed and airspeed. This allows the plane to cope with a failing airspeed sensor. A value of zero means to use the airspeed as is. See ARSPD_OPTIONS and ARSPD_MAX_WIND to disable airspeed sensors.

Name: AHRS_TRIM_X
Description: Compensates for the roll angle difference between the control board and the frame. Positive values make the vehicle roll right.

Name: AHRS_TRIM_Y
Description: Compensates for the pitch angle difference between the control board and the frame. Positive values make the vehicle pitch up/back.

Name: AHRS_TRIM_Z
Description: Not Used

Name: AHRS_ORIENTATION
Description: Overall board orientation relative to the standard orientation for the board type. This rotates the IMU and compass readings to allow the board to be oriented in your vehicle at any 90 or 45 degree angle. The label for each option is specified in the order of rotations for that orientation. This option takes affect on next boot. After changing you will need to re-level your vehicle.

Name: AHRS_COMP_BETA
Description: This controls the time constant for the cross-over frequency used to fuse AHRS (airspeed and heading) and GPS data to estimate ground velocity. Time constant is 0.1/beta. A larger time constant will use GPS data less and a small time constant will use air data less.

Name: AHRS_GPS_MINSATS
Description: Minimum number of satellites visible to use GPS for velocity based corrections attitude correction. This defaults to 6, which is about the point at which the velocity numbers from a GPS become too unreliable for accurate correction of the accelerometers.

Name: AHRS_EKF_TYPE
Description: This controls which NavEKF Kalman filter version is used for attitude and position estimation

Name: AHRS_CUSTOM_ROLL
Description: Autopilot mounting position roll offset. Positive values = roll right, negative values = roll left. This parameter is only used when AHRS_ORIENTATION is set to CUSTOM.

Name: AHRS_CUSTOM_PIT
Description: Autopilot mounting position pitch offset. Positive values = pitch up, negative values = pitch down. This parameter is only used when AHRS_ORIENTATION is set to CUSTOM.

Name: AHRS_CUSTOM_YAW
Description: Autopilot mounting position yaw offset. Positive values = yaw right, negative values = yaw left. This parameter is only used when AHRS_ORIENTATION is set to CUSTOM.

Name: ARMING_ACCTHRESH
Description: Accelerometer error threshold used to determine inconsistent accelerometers. Compares this error range to other accelerometers to detect a hardware or calibration error. Lower value means tighter check and harder to pass arming check. Not all accelerometers are created equal.

Name: ARMING_RUDDER
Description: Allow arm/disarm by rudder input. When enabled arming can be done with right rudder, disarming with left rudder. Rudder arming only works in manual throttle modes with throttle at zero +- deadzone (RCx_DZ)

Name: ARMING_MIS_ITEMS
Description: Bitmask of mission items that are required to be planned in order to arm the aircraft

Name: ARMING_CHECK
Description: Checks prior to arming motor. This is a bitmask of checks that will be performed before allowing arming. For most users it is recommended to leave this at the default of 1 (all checks enabled). You can select whatever checks you prefer by adding together the values of each check type to set this parameter. For example, to only allow arming when you have GPS lock and no RC failsafe you would set ARMING_CHECK to 72.

Name: AROT_ENABLE
Description: Allows you to enable (1) or disable (0) the autonomous autorotation capability.

Name: AROT_HS_P
Description: Increase value to increase sensitivity of head speed controller during autonomous autorotation.

Name: AROT_HS_SET_PT
Description: The target head speed in RPM during autorotation.  Start by setting to desired hover speed and tune from there as necessary.

Name: AROT_TARG_SP
Description: Target ground speed in cm/s for the autorotation controller to try and achieve/ maintain during the glide phase.

Name: AROT_COL_FILT_E
Description: Cut-off frequency for collective low pass filter.  For the entry phase.  Acts as a following trim.  Must be higher than AROT_COL_FILT_G.

Name: AROT_COL_FILT_G
Description: Cut-off frequency for collective low pass filter.  For the glide phase.  Acts as a following trim.  Must be lower than AROT_COL_FILT_E.

Name: AROT_AS_ACC_MAX
Description: Maximum forward acceleration to apply in speed controller.

Name: AROT_BAIL_TIME
Description: Time in seconds from bail out initiated to the exit of autorotation flight mode.

Name: AROT_HS_SENSOR
Description: Allocate the RPM sensor instance to use for measuring head speed.  RPM1 = 0.  RPM2 = 1.

Name: AROT_FW_V_P
Description: Velocity (horizontal) P gain.  Determines the propotion of the target acceleration based on the velocity error.

Name: AROT_FW_V_FF
Description: Velocity (horizontal) input filter.  Corrects the target acceleration proportionally to the desired velocity.

Name: ARSPD_TYPE
Description: Type of airspeed sensor

Name: ARSPD_DEVID
Description: Airspeed sensor ID, taking into account its type, bus and instance

Name: ARSPD_USE
Description: Enables airspeed use for automatic throttle modes and replaces control from THR_TRIM. Continues to display and log airspeed if set to 0. Uses airspeed for control if set to 1. Only uses airspeed when throttle = 0 if set to 2 (useful for gliders with airspeed sensors behind propellers).

Name: ARSPD_OFFSET
Description: Airspeed calibration offset

Name: ARSPD_RATIO
Description: Calibrates pitot tube pressure to velocity. Increasing this value will indicate a higher airspeed at any given dynamic pressure.

Name: ARSPD_PIN
Description: The pin number that the airspeed sensor is connected to for analog sensors. Set to 15 on the Pixhawk for the analog airspeed port.

Name: ARSPD_AUTOCAL
Description: Enables automatic adjustment of ARSPD_RATIO during a calibration flight based on estimation of ground speed and true airspeed. New ratio saved every 2 minutes if change is > 5%. Should not be left enabled.

Name: ARSPD_TUBE_ORDER
Description: This parameter allows you to control whether the order in which the tubes are attached to your pitot tube matters. If you set this to 0 then the first (often the top) connector on the sensor needs to be the stagnation pressure (the pressure at the tip of the pitot tube). If set to 1 then the second (often the bottom) connector needs to be the stagnation pressure. If set to 2 (the default) then the airspeed driver will accept either order. The reason you may wish to specify the order is it will allow your airspeed sensor to detect if the aircraft is receiving excessive pressure on the static port compared to the stagnation port such as during a stall, which would otherwise be seen as a positive airspeed.

Name: ARSPD_SKIP_CAL
Description: This parameter allows you to skip airspeed offset calibration on startup, instead using the offset from the last calibration. This may be desirable if the offset variance between flights for your sensor is low and you want to avoid having to cover the pitot tube on each boot.

Name: ARSPD_PSI_RANGE
Description: This parameter allows you to to set the PSI (pounds per square inch) range for your sensor. You should not change this unless you examine the datasheet for your device

Name: ARSPD_BUS
Description: Bus number of the I2C bus where the airspeed sensor is connected

Name: ARSPD_PRIMARY
Description: This selects which airspeed sensor will be the primary if multiple sensors are found

Name: ARSPD_OPTIONS
Description: Bitmask of options to use with airspeed. 0:Disable use based on airspeed/groundspeed mismatch (see ARSPD_WIND_MAX), 1:Automatically reenable use based on airspeed/groundspeed mismatch recovery (see ARSPD_WIND_MAX) 2:Disable voltage correction

Name: ARSPD_WIND_MAX
Description: If the difference between airspeed and ground speed is greater than this value the sensor will be marked unhealthy. Using ARSPD_OPTION this health value can be used to disable the sensor.

Name: ARSPD_WIND_WARN
Description: If the difference between airspeed and ground speed is greater than this value the sensor will issue a warning. If 0 ARSPD_WIND_MAX is used.

Name: ARSPD2_TYPE
Description: Type of 2nd airspeed sensor

Name: ARSPD2_USE
Description: use airspeed for flight control. When set to 0 airspeed sensor can be logged and displayed on a GCS but won't be used for flight. When set to 1 it will be logged and used. When set to 2 it will be only used when the throttle is zero, which can be useful in gliders with airspeed sensors behind a propeller

Name: ARSPD2_OFFSET
Description: Airspeed calibration offset

Name: ARSPD2_RATIO
Description: Airspeed calibration ratio

Name: ARSPD2_PIN
Description: Pin number indicating location of analog airspeed sensors. Pixhawk/Cube if set to 15.

Name: ARSPD2_AUTOCAL
Description: If this is enabled then the autopilot will automatically adjust the ARSPD_RATIO during flight, based upon an estimation filter using ground speed and true airspeed. The automatic calibration will save the new ratio to EEPROM every 2 minutes if it changes by more than 5%. This option should be enabled for a calibration flight then disabled again when calibration is complete. Leaving it enabled all the time is not recommended.

Name: ARSPD2_TUBE_ORDR
Description: This parameter allows you to control whether the order in which the tubes are attached to your pitot tube matters. If you set this to 0 then the first (often the top) connector on the sensor needs to be the stagnation pressure (the pressure at the tip of the pitot tube). If set to 1 then the second (often the bottom) connector needs to be the stagnation pressure. If set to 2 (the default) then the airspeed driver will accept either order. The reason you may wish to specify the order is it will allow your airspeed sensor to detect if the aircraft is receiving excessive pressure on the static port compared to the stagnation port such as during a stall, which would otherwise be seen as a positive airspeed.

Name: ARSPD2_SKIP_CAL
Description: This parameter allows you to skip airspeed offset calibration on startup, instead using the offset from the last calibration. This may be desirable if the offset variance between flights for your sensor is low and you want to avoid having to cover the pitot tube on each boot.

Name: ARSPD2_PSI_RANGE
Description: This parameter allows you to to set the PSI (pounds per square inch) range for your sensor. You should not change this unless you examine the datasheet for your device

Name: ARSPD2_BUS
Description: The bus number of the I2C bus to look for the sensor on

Name: ARSPD2_DEVID
Description: Airspeed2 sensor ID, taking into account its type, bus and instance

Name: ATC_SLEW_YAW
Description: Maximum rate the yaw target can be updated in Loiter, RTL, Auto flight modes

Name: ATC_ACCEL_Y_MAX
Description: Maximum acceleration in yaw axis

Name: ATC_RATE_FF_ENAB
Description: Controls whether body-frame rate feedfoward is enabled or disabled

Name: ATC_ACCEL_R_MAX
Description: Maximum acceleration in roll axis

Name: ATC_ACCEL_P_MAX
Description: Maximum acceleration in pitch axis

Name: ATC_ANGLE_BOOST
Description: Angle Boost increases output throttle as the vehicle leans to reduce loss of altitude

Name: ATC_ANG_RLL_P
Description: Roll axis angle controller P gain.  Converts the error between the desired roll angle and actual angle to a desired roll rate

Name: ATC_ANG_PIT_P
Description: Pitch axis angle controller P gain.  Converts the error between the desired pitch angle and actual angle to a desired pitch rate

Name: ATC_ANG_YAW_P
Description: Yaw axis angle controller P gain.  Converts the error between the desired yaw angle and actual angle to a desired yaw rate

Name: ATC_ANG_LIM_TC
Description: Angle Limit (to maintain altitude) Time Constant

Name: ATC_RATE_R_MAX
Description: Maximum angular velocity in roll axis

Name: ATC_RATE_P_MAX
Description: Maximum angular velocity in pitch axis

Name: ATC_RATE_Y_MAX
Description: Maximum angular velocity in yaw axis

Name: ATC_INPUT_TC
Description: Attitude control input time constant.  Low numbers lead to sharper response, higher numbers to softer response

Name: ATC_RAT_RLL_P
Description: Roll axis rate controller P gain.  Converts the difference between desired roll rate and actual roll rate into a motor speed output

Name: ATC_RAT_RLL_I
Description: Roll axis rate controller I gain.  Corrects long-term difference in desired roll rate vs actual roll rate

Name: ATC_RAT_RLL_IMAX
Description: Roll axis rate controller I gain maximum.  Constrains the maximum motor output that the I gain will output

Name: ATC_RAT_RLL_D
Description: Roll axis rate controller D gain.  Compensates for short-term change in desired roll rate vs actual roll rate

Name: ATC_RAT_RLL_FF
Description: Roll axis rate controller feed forward

Name: ATC_RAT_RLL_FLTT
Description: Roll axis rate controller target frequency in Hz

Name: ATC_RAT_RLL_FLTE
Description: Roll axis rate controller error frequency in Hz

Name: ATC_RAT_RLL_FLTD
Description: Roll axis rate controller derivative frequency in Hz

Name: ATC_RAT_RLL_SMAX
Description: Sets an upper limit on the slew rate produced by the combined P and D gains. If the amplitude of the control action produced by the rate feedback exceeds this value, then the D+P gain is reduced to respect the limit. This limits the amplitude of high frequency oscillations caused by an excessive gain. The limit should be set to no more than 25% of the actuators maximum slew rate to allow for load effects. Note: The gain will not be reduced to less than 10% of the nominal value. A value of zero will disable this feature.

Name: ATC_RAT_PIT_P
Description: Pitch axis rate controller P gain.  Converts the difference between desired pitch rate and actual pitch rate into a motor speed output

Name: ATC_RAT_PIT_I
Description: Pitch axis rate controller I gain.  Corrects long-term difference in desired pitch rate vs actual pitch rate

Name: ATC_RAT_PIT_IMAX
Description: Pitch axis rate controller I gain maximum.  Constrains the maximum motor output that the I gain will output

Name: ATC_RAT_PIT_D
Description: Pitch axis rate controller D gain.  Compensates for short-term change in desired pitch rate vs actual pitch rate

Name: ATC_RAT_PIT_FF
Description: Pitch axis rate controller feed forward

Name: ATC_RAT_PIT_FLTT
Description: Pitch axis rate controller target frequency in Hz

Name: ATC_RAT_PIT_FLTE
Description: Pitch axis rate controller error frequency in Hz

Name: ATC_RAT_PIT_FLTD
Description: Pitch axis rate controller derivative frequency in Hz

Name: ATC_RAT_PIT_SMAX
Description: Sets an upper limit on the slew rate produced by the combined P and D gains. If the amplitude of the control action produced by the rate feedback exceeds this value, then the D+P gain is reduced to respect the limit. This limits the amplitude of high frequency oscillations caused by an excessive gain. The limit should be set to no more than 25% of the actuators maximum slew rate to allow for load effects. Note: The gain will not be reduced to less than 10% of the nominal value. A value of zero will disable this feature.

Name: ATC_RAT_YAW_P
Description: Yaw axis rate controller P gain.  Converts the difference between desired yaw rate and actual yaw rate into a motor speed output

Name: ATC_RAT_YAW_I
Description: Yaw axis rate controller I gain.  Corrects long-term difference in desired yaw rate vs actual yaw rate

Name: ATC_RAT_YAW_IMAX
Description: Yaw axis rate controller I gain maximum.  Constrains the maximum motor output that the I gain will output

Name: ATC_RAT_YAW_D
Description: Yaw axis rate controller D gain.  Compensates for short-term change in desired yaw rate vs actual yaw rate

Name: ATC_RAT_YAW_FF
Description: Yaw axis rate controller feed forward

Name: ATC_RAT_YAW_FLTT
Description: Yaw axis rate controller target frequency in Hz

Name: ATC_RAT_YAW_FLTE
Description: Yaw axis rate controller error frequency in Hz

Name: ATC_RAT_YAW_FLTD
Description: Yaw axis rate controller derivative frequency in Hz

Name: ATC_RAT_YAW_SMAX
Description: Sets an upper limit on the slew rate produced by the combined P and D gains. If the amplitude of the control action produced by the rate feedback exceeds this value, then the D+P gain is reduced to respect the limit. This limits the amplitude of high frequency oscillations caused by an excessive gain. The limit should be set to no more than 25% of the actuators maximum slew rate to allow for load effects. Note: The gain will not be reduced to less than 10% of the nominal value. A value of zero will disable this feature.

Name: ATC_THR_MIX_MIN
Description: Throttle vs attitude control prioritisation used when landing (higher values mean we prioritise attitude control over throttle)

Name: ATC_THR_MIX_MAX
Description: Throttle vs attitude control prioritisation used during active flight (higher values mean we prioritise attitude control over throttle)

Name: ATC_THR_MIX_MAN
Description: Throttle vs attitude control prioritisation used during manual flight (higher values mean we prioritise attitude control over throttle)

Name: ATC_HOVR_ROL_TRM
Description: Trim the hover roll angle to counter tail rotor thrust in a hover

Name: ATC_RAT_RLL_P
Description: Roll axis rate controller P gain.  Converts the difference between desired roll rate and actual roll rate into a motor speed output

Name: ATC_RAT_RLL_I
Description: Roll axis rate controller I gain.  Corrects long-term difference in desired roll rate vs actual roll rate

Name: ATC_RAT_RLL_IMAX
Description: Roll axis rate controller I gain maximum.  Constrains the maximum motor output that the I gain will output

Name: ATC_RAT_RLL_ILMI
Description: Point below which I-term will not leak down

Name: ATC_RAT_RLL_D
Description: Roll axis rate controller D gain.  Compensates for short-term change in desired roll rate vs actual roll rate

Name: ATC_RAT_RLL_FF
Description: Roll axis rate controller feed forward

Name: ATC_RAT_RLL_FLTT
Description: Roll axis rate controller target frequency in Hz

Name: ATC_RAT_RLL_FLTE

Name: ATC_PIRO_COMP
Description: Pirouette compensation enabled

Name: AUTOTUNE_AXES
Description: 1-byte bitmap of axes to autotune

Name: AUTOTUNE_AGGR
Description: Autotune aggressiveness. Defines the bounce back used to detect size of the D term.

Name: AUTOTUNE_MIN_D
Description: Defines the minimum D gain

Name: AUTOTUNE_AXES
Description: 1-byte bitmap of axes to autotune

Name: AUTOTUNE_SEQ
Description: 2-byte bitmask to select what tuning should be performed.  Max gain automatically performed if Rate D is selected. Values: 7:All,1:VFF Only,2:Rate D/Rate P Only(incl max gain),4:Angle P Only,8:Max Gain Only,3:VFF and Rate D/Rate P(incl max gain),5:VFF and Angle P,6:Rate D/Rate P(incl max gain) and angle P

Name: AUTOTUNE_FRQ_MIN
Description: Defines the start frequency for sweeps and dwells

Name: AUTOTUNE_FRQ_MAX
Description: Defines the end frequency for sweeps and dwells

Name: AUTOTUNE_GN_MAX
Description: Defines the response gain (output/input) to tune

Name: AUTOTUNE_VELXY_P
Description: Velocity xy P gain used to hold position during Max Gain, Rate P, and Rate D frequency sweeps

Name: AVD_ENABLE
Description: Enable Avoidance using ADSB

Name: AVD_F_ACTION
Description: Specifies aircraft behaviour when a collision is imminent

Name: AVD_W_ACTION
Description: Specifies aircraft behaviour when a collision may occur

Name: AVD_F_RCVRY
Description: Determines what the aircraft will do after a fail event is resolved

Name: AVD_OBS_MAX
Description: Maximum number of obstacles to track

Name: AVD_W_TIME
Description: Aircraft velocity vectors are multiplied by this time to determine closest approach.  If this results in an approach closer than W_DIST_XY or W_DIST_Z then W_ACTION is undertaken (assuming F_ACTION is not undertaken)

Name: AVD_F_TIME
Description: Aircraft velocity vectors are multiplied by this time to determine closest approach.  If this results in an approach closer than F_DIST_XY or F_DIST_Z then F_ACTION is undertaken

Name: AVD_W_DIST_XY
Description: Closest allowed projected distance before W_ACTION is undertaken

Name: AVD_F_DIST_XY
Description: Closest allowed projected distance before F_ACTION is undertaken

Name: AVD_W_DIST_Z
Description: Closest allowed projected distance before BEHAVIOUR_W is undertaken

Name: AVD_F_DIST_Z
Description: Closest allowed projected distance before BEHAVIOUR_F is undertaken

Name: AVD_F_ALT_MIN
Description: Minimum AMSL (above mean sea level) altitude for ADS-B avoidance. If the vehicle is below this altitude, no avoidance action will take place. Useful to prevent ADS-B avoidance from activating while below the tree line or around structures. Default of 0 is no minimum.

Name: AVOID_ENABLE
Description: Enabled/disable avoidance input sources

Name: AVOID_ANGLE_MAX
Description: Max lean angle used to avoid obstacles while in non-GPS modes

Name: AVOID_DIST_MAX
Description: Distance from object at which obstacle avoidance will begin in non-GPS modes

Name: AVOID_MARGIN
Description: Vehicle will attempt to stay at least this distance (in meters) from objects while in GPS modes

Name: AVOID_BEHAVE
Description: Avoidance behaviour (slide or stop)

Name: AVOID_BACKUP_SPD
Description: Maximum speed that will be used to back away from obstacles in GPS modes (m/s). Set zero to disable

Name: AVOID_ALT_MIN
Description: Minimum altitude above which proximity based avoidance will start working. This requires a valid downward facing rangefinder reading to work. Set zero to disable

Name: AVOID_ACCEL_MAX
Description: Maximum acceleration with which obstacles will be avoided with. Set zero to disable acceleration limits

Name: AVOID_BACKUP_DZ
Description: Distance beyond AVOID_MARGIN parameter, after which vehicle will backaway from obstacles. Increase this parameter if you see vehicle going back and forth in front of obstacle.

Name: BARO1_GND_PRESS
Description: calibrated ground pressure in Pascals

Name: BARO_GND_TEMP
Description: User provided ambient ground temperature in degrees Celsius. This is used to improve the calculation of the altitude the vehicle is at. This parameter is not persistent and will be reset to 0 every time the vehicle is rebooted. A value of 0 means use the internal measurement ambient temperature.

Name: BARO_ALT_OFFSET
Description: altitude offset in meters added to barometric altitude. This is used to allow for automatic adjustment of the base barometric altitude by a ground station equipped with a barometer. The value is added to the barometric altitude read by the aircraft. It is automatically reset to 0 when the barometer is calibrated on each reboot or when a preflight calibration is performed.

Name: BARO_PRIMARY
Description: This selects which barometer will be the primary if multiple barometers are found

Name: BARO_EXT_BUS
Description: This selects the bus number for looking for an I2C barometer. When set to -1 it will probe all external i2c buses based on the GND_PROBE_EXT parameter.

Name: BARO_SPEC_GRAV
Description: This sets the specific gravity of the fluid when flying an underwater ROV.

Name: BARO2_GND_PRESS
Description: calibrated ground pressure in Pascals

Name: BARO3_GND_PRESS
Description: calibrated ground pressure in Pascals

Name: BARO_FLTR_RNG
Description: This sets the range around the average value that new samples must be within to be accepted. This can help reduce the impact of noise on sensors that are on long I2C cables. The value is a percentage from the average value. A value of zero disables this filter.

Name: BARO_PROBE_EXT
Description: This sets which types of external i2c barometer to look for. It is a bitmask of barometer types. The I2C buses to probe is based on GND_EXT_BUS. If BARO_EXT_BUS is -1 then it will probe all external buses, otherwise it will probe just the bus number given in GND_EXT_BUS.

Name: BARO1_DEVID
Description: Barometer sensor ID, taking into account its type, bus and instance

Name: BARO2_DEVID
Description: Barometer2 sensor ID, taking into account its type, bus and instance

Name: BARO3_DEVID
Description: Barometer3 sensor ID, taking into account its type, bus and instance

Name: BARO1_WCF_ENABLE
Description: This enables the use of wind coefficients for barometer compensation

Name: BARO1_WCF_FWD
Description: This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a positive wind relative velocity along the X body axis. If the baro height estimate rises during forwards flight, then this will be a negative number. Multirotors can use this feature only if using EKF3 and if the EK3_BCOEF_X and EK3_BCOEF_Y parameters have been tuned.

Name: BARO1_WCF_BCK
Description: This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a negative wind relative velocity along the X body axis. If the baro height estimate rises during backwards flight, then this will be a negative number. Multirotors can use this feature only if using EKF3 and if the EK3_BCOEF_X and EK3_BCOEF_Y parameters have been tuned.

Name: BARO1_WCF_RGT
Description: This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a positive wind relative velocity along the Y body axis. If the baro height estimate rises during sideways flight to the right, then this should be a negative number. Multirotors can use this feature only if using EKF3 and if the EK3_BCOEF_X and EK3_BCOEF_Y parameters have been tuned.

Name: BARO1_WCF_LFT
Description: This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a negative wind relative velocity along the Y body axis. If the baro height estimate rises during sideways flight to the left, then this should be a negative number. Multirotors can use this feature only if using EKF3 and if the EK3_BCOEF_X and EK3_BCOEF_Y parameters have been tuned.

Name: BARO2_WCF_ENABLE
Description: This enables the use of wind coefficients for barometer compensation

Name: BARO2_WCF_FWD
Description: This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a positive wind relative velocity along the X body axis. If the baro height estimate rises during forwards flight, then this will be a negative number. Multirotors can use this feature only if using EKF3 and if the EK3_BCOEF_X and EK3_BCOEF_Y parameters have been tuned.

Name: BARO2_WCF_BCK
Description: This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a negative wind relative velocity along the X body axis. If the baro height estimate rises during backwards flight, then this will be a negative number. Multirotors can use this feature only if using EKF3 and if the EK3_BCOEF_X and EK3_BCOEF_Y parameters have been tuned.

Name: BARO2_WCF_RGT
Description: This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a positive wind relative velocity along the Y body axis. If the baro height estimate rises during sideways flight to the right, then this should be a negative number. Multirotors can use this feature only if using EKF3 and if the EK3_BCOEF_X and EK3_BCOEF_Y parameters have been tuned.

Name: BARO2_WCF_LFT
Description: This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a negative wind relative velocity along the Y body axis. If the baro height estimate rises during sideways flight to the left, then this should be a negative number. Multirotors can use this feature only if using EKF3 and if the EK3_BCOEF_X and EK3_BCOEF_Y parameters have been tuned.

Name: BARO3_WCF_ENABLE
Description: This enables the use of wind coefficients for barometer compensation

Name: BARO3_WCF_FWD
Description: This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a positive wind relative velocity along the X body axis. If the baro height estimate rises during forwards flight, then this will be a negative number. Multirotors can use this feature only if using EKF3 and if the EK3_BCOEF_X and EK3_BCOEF_Y parameters have been tuned.

If the baro height estimate rises during backwards flight, then this will be a negative number. Multirotors can use this feature only if using EKF3 and if the EK3_BCOEF_X and EK3_BCOEF_Y parameters have been tuned.

Description: This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a positive wind relative velocity along the Y body axis. If the baro height estimate rises during sideways flight to the right, then this should be a negative number. If the baro height estimate rises during sideways flight to the left, then this should be a negative number. Name: BATT2_MONITOR
Description: Controls enabling monitoring of the battery's voltage and current

Name: BATT2_CAPACITY
Description: Capacity of the battery in mAh when full

Name: BATT2_SERIAL_NUM
Description: Battery serial number, automatically filled in for SMBus batteries, otherwise will be -1. With DroneCan it is the battery_id.

Name: BATT2_LOW_TIMER
Description: This is the timeout in seconds before a low voltage event will be triggered. For aircraft with low C batteries it may be necessary to raise this in order to cope with low voltage on long takeoffs. A value of zero disables low voltage errors.

Name: BATT2_FS_VOLTSRC
Description: Voltage type used for detection of low voltage event

Name: BATT2_LOW_VOLT
Description: Battery voltage that triggers a low battery failsafe. Set to 0 to disable. If the battery voltage drops below this voltage continuously for more then the period specified by the BATT2_LOW_TIMER parameter then the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATT2_FS_LOW_ACT parameter.

Name: BATT2_LOW_MAH
Description: Battery capacity at which the low battery failsafe is triggered. Set to 0 to disable battery remaining failsafe. If the battery capacity drops below this level the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATT2_FS_LOW_ACT parameter.

Name: BATT2_CRT_VOLT
Description: Battery voltage that triggers a critical battery failsafe. Set to 0 to disable. If the battery voltage drops below this voltage continuously for more then the period specified by the BATT2_LOW_TIMER parameter then the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATT2_FS_CRT_ACT parameter.

Name: BATT2_CRT_MAH
Description: Battery capacity at which the critical battery failsafe is triggered. Set to 0 to disable battery remaining failsafe. If the battery capacity drops below this level the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATT2__FS_CRT_ACT parameter.

Name: BATT2_FS_LOW_ACT
Description: What action the vehicle should perform if it hits a low battery failsafe

Name: BATT2_FS_CRT_ACT
Description: What action the vehicle should perform if it hits a critical battery failsafe

Name: BATT2_ARM_VOLT
Description: Battery voltage level which is required to arm the aircraft. Set to 0 to allow arming at any voltage.

Name: BATT2_ARM_MAH
Description: Battery capacity remaining which is required to arm the aircraft. Set to 0 to allow arming at any capacity. Note that execept for smart batteries rebooting the vehicle will always reset the remaining capacity estimate, which can lead to this check not providing sufficent protection, it is recommended to always use this in conjunction with the BATT2__ARM_VOLT parameter.

Name: BATT2_OPTIONS
Description: This sets options to change the behaviour of the battery monitor

Name: BATT2_VOLT_PIN
Description: Sets the analog input pin that should be used for voltage monitoring.

Name: BATT2_CURR_PIN
Description: Sets the analog input pin that should be used for current monitoring.

Name: BATT2_VOLT_MULT
Description: Used to convert the voltage of the voltage sensing pin (BATT2_VOLT_PIN) to the actual battery's voltage (pin_voltage * VOLT_MULT). For the 3DR Power brick with a Pixhawk, this should be set to 10.1. For the Pixhawk with the 3DR 4in1 ESC this should be 12.02. For the PX using the PX4IO power supply this should be set to 1.

Name: BATT2_AMP_PERVLT
Description: Number of amps that a 1V reading on the current sensor corresponds to. With a Pixhawk using the 3DR Power brick this should be set to 17. For the Pixhawk with the 3DR 4in1 ESC this should be 17.

Name: BATT2_AMP_OFFSET
Description: Voltage offset at zero current on current sensor

Name: BATT2_VLT_OFFSET
Description: Voltage offset on voltage pin. This allows for an offset due to a diode. This voltage is subtracted before the scaling is applied

Name: BATT2_I2C_BUS
Description: Battery monitor I2C bus number

Name: BATT2_I2C_ADDR
Description: Battery monitor I2C address

Name: BATT2_SUM_MASK
Description: 0: sum of remaining battery monitors, If none 0 sum of specified monitors. Current will be summed and voltages averaged.

Name: BATT2_CURR_MULT
Description: Multiplier applied to all current related reports to allow for adjustment if no UAVCAN param access or current splitting applications

Name: BATT3_MONITOR
Description: Controls enabling monitoring of the battery's voltage and current

Name: BATT3_CAPACITY

Name: BATT3_I2C_BUS

Name: BATT3_CURR_MULT
Description: Multiplier applied to all current related reports to allow for adjustment if no UAVCAN param access or current splitting applications

Name: BATT4_MONITOR
Description: Controls enabling monitoring of the battery's voltage and current

Name: BATT4_CAPACITY
Description: Capacity of the battery in mAh when full

Name: BATT4_SERIAL_NUM
Description: Battery serial number, automatically filled in for SMBus batteries, otherwise will be -1. With DroneCan it is the battery_id.

Name: BATT4_LOW_TIMER
Description: This is the timeout in seconds before a low voltage event will be triggered. For aircraft with low C batteries it may be necessary to raise this in order to cope with low voltage on long takeoffs. A value of zero disables low voltage errors.

Name: BATT4_FS_VOLTSRC
Description: Voltage type used for detection of low voltage event

Name: BATT4_LOW_VOLT
Description: Battery voltage that triggers a low battery failsafe. Set to 0 to disable. If the battery voltage drops below this voltage continuously for more then the period specified by the BATT4_LOW_TIMER parameter then the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATT4_FS_LOW_ACT parameter.

Name: BATT4_LOW_MAH
Description: Battery capacity at which the low battery failsafe is triggered. Set to 0 to disable battery remaining failsafe. If the battery capacity drops below this level the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATT4_FS_LOW_ACT parameter.

Name: BATT4_CRT_VOLT
Description: Battery voltage that triggers a critical battery failsafe. Set to 0 to disable. If the battery voltage drops below this voltage continuously for more then the period specified by the BATT4_LOW_TIMER parameter then the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATT4_FS_CRT_ACT parameter.

Name: BATT4_CRT_MAH
Description: Battery capacity at which the critical battery failsafe is triggered. Set to 0 to disable battery remaining failsafe. If the battery capacity drops below this level the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATT4__FS_CRT_ACT parameter.

Name: BATT4_FS_LOW_ACT
Description: What action the vehicle should perform if it hits a low battery failsafe

Name: BATT4_FS_CRT_ACT
Description: What action the vehicle should perform if it hits a critical battery failsafe

Name: BATT4_ARM_VOLT
Description: Battery voltage level which is required to arm the aircraft. Set to 0 to allow arming at any voltage.

Name: BATT4_ARM_MAH
Description: Battery capacity remaining which is required to arm the aircraft. Set to 0 to allow arming at any capacity. Note that execept for smart batteries rebooting the vehicle will always reset the remaining capacity estimate, which can lead to this check not providing sufficent protection, it is recommended to always use this in conjunction with the BATT4__ARM_VOLT parameter.

Name: BATT4_OPTIONS
Description: This sets options to change the behaviour of the battery monitor

Name: BATT4_VOLT_PIN
Description: Sets the analog input pin that should be used for voltage monitoring.

Name: BATT4_CURR_PIN
Description: Sets the analog input pin that should be used for current monitoring.

Name: BATT4_VOLT_MULT
Description: Used to convert the voltage of the voltage sensing pin (BATT4_VOLT_PIN) to the actual battery's voltage (pin_voltage * VOLT_MULT). For the 3DR Power brick with a Pixhawk, this should be set to 10.1. For the Pixhawk with the 3DR 4in1 ESC this should be 12.02. For the PX using the PX4IO power supply this should be set to 1.

Name: BATT4_AMP_PERVLT
Description: Number of amps that a 1V reading on the current sensor corresponds to. With a Pixhawk using the 3DR Power brick this should be set to 17. For the Pixhawk with the 3DR 4in1 ESC this should be 17.

Name: BATT4_AMP_OFFSET
Description: Voltage offset at zero current on current sensor

Name: BATT4_VLT_OFFSET
Description: Voltage offset on voltage pin. This allows for an offset due to a diode. This voltage is subtracted before the scaling is applied

Name: BATT4_I2C_BUS
Description: Battery monitor I2C bus number

Name: BATT4_I2C_ADDR
Description: Battery monitor I2C address

Name: BATT4_SUM_MASK
Description: 0: sum of remaining battery monitors, If none 0 sum of specified monitors. Current will be summed and voltages averaged.

Name: BATT4_CURR_MULT
Description: Multiplier applied to all current related reports to allow for adjustment if no UAVCAN param access or current splitting applications

Name: BCN_TYPE
Description: What type of beacon based position estimation device is connected

Name: BCN_LATITUDE
Description: Beacon origin's latitude

Name: BCN_LONGITUDE
Description: Beacon origin's longitude

Name: BCN_ALT
Description: Beacon origin's altitude above sealevel in meters

Name: BCN_ORIENT_YAW
Description: Beacon systems rotation from north in degrees

Name: BRD_SER1_RTSCTS
Description: Enable flow control on serial 1 (telemetry 1). You must have the RTS and CTS pins connected to your radio. The standard DF13 6 pin connector for a 3DR radio does have those pins connected. If this is set to 2 then flow control will be auto-detected by checking for the output buffer filling on startup. Note that the PX4v1 does not have hardware flow control pins on this port, so you should leave this disabled.

Name: BRD_SER2_RTSCTS
Description: Enable flow control on serial 2 (telemetry 2). You must have the RTS and CTS pins connected to your radio. The standard DF13 6 pin connector for a 3DR radio does have those pins connected. If this is set to 2 then flow control will be auto-detected by checking for the output buffer filling on startup.

Name: BRD_SER3_RTSCTS
Description: Enable flow control on serial 3. You must have the RTS and CTS pins connected to your radio. The standard DF13 6 pin connector for a 3DR radio does have those pins connected. If this is set to 2 then flow control will be auto-detected by checking for the output buffer filling on startup.

Name: BRD_SER4_RTSCTS
Description: Enable flow control on serial 4. You must have the RTS and CTS pins connected to your radio. The standard DF13 6 pin connector for a 3DR radio does have those pins connected. If this is set to 2 then flow control will be auto-detected by checking for the output buffer filling on startup.

Name: BRD_SER5_RTSCTS
Description: Enable flow control on serial 5. You must have the RTS and CTS pins connected to your radio. The standard DF13 6 pin connector for a 3DR radio does have those pins connected. If this is set to 2 then flow control will be auto-detected by checking for the output buffer filling on startup.

Name: BRD_SAFETYENABLE
Description: This controls the default state of the safety switch at startup. When set to 1 the safety switch will start in the safe state (flashing) at boot. When set to zero the safety switch will start in the unsafe state (solid) at startup. Note that if a safety switch is fitted the user can still control the safety state after startup using the switch. The safety state can also be controlled in software using a MAVLink message.

Name: BRD_SBUS_OUT
Description: This sets the SBUS output frame rate in Hz

Name: BRD_SERIAL_NUM
Description: User-defined serial number of this vehicle, it can be any arbitrary number you want and has no effect on the autopilot

Name: BRD_SAFETY_MASK
Description: A bitmask which controls what outputs can move while the safety switch has not been pressed

Name: BRD_HEAT_TARG
Description: Board heater target temperature for boards with controllable heating units. DO NOT SET to -1 on the Cube. Set to -1 to disable the heater, please reboot after setting to -1.

Name: BRD_TYPE
Description: This allows selection of a PX4 or VRBRAIN board type. If set to zero then the board type is auto-detected (PX4)

Name: BRD_IO_ENABLE
Description: This allows for the IO co-processor on FMUv1 and FMUv2 to be disabled

Name: BRD_SAFETYOPTION
Description: This controls the activation of the safety button. It allows you to control if the safety button can be used for safety enable and/or disable, and whether the button is only active when disarmed

Name: BRD_VBUS_MIN
Description: Minimum voltage on the autopilot power rail to allow the aircraft to arm. 0 to disable the check.

Name: BRD_VSERVO_MIN
Description: Minimum voltage on the servo rail to allow the aircraft to arm. 0 to disable the check.

Name: BRD_SD_SLOWDOWN
Description: This is a scaling factor to slow down microSD operation. It can be used on flight board and microSD card combinations where full speed is not reliable. For normal full speed operation a value of 0 should be used.

Name: BRD_PWM_VOLT_SEL
Description: This sets the voltage max for PWM output pulses. 0 for 3.3V and 1 for 5V output.

Name: BRD_OPTIONS
Description: Board specific option flags

Name: BRD_BOOT_DELAY
Description: This adds a delay in milliseconds to boot to ensure peripherals initialise fully

Name: BRD_HEAT_P
Description: Board Heater P gain

Name: BRD_HEAT_I
Description: Board Heater integrator gain

Name: BRD_HEAT_IMAX
Description: Board Heater integrator maximum

Name: BRD_ALT_CONFIG
Description: Select an alternative hardware configuration. A value of zero selects the default configuration for this board. Other values are board specific. Please see the documentation for your board for details on any alternative configuration values that may be available.

Name: BRD_HEAT_LOWMGN
Description: Arming check will fail if temp is lower than this margin below BRD_HEAT_TARG. 0 disables the low temperature check

Name: BRD_RADIO_TYPE
Description: This enables support for direct attached radio receivers

Name: BRD_RADIO_PROT
Description: Select air protocol

Name: BRD_RADIO_DEBUG
Description: radio debug level

Name: BRD_RADIO_DISCRC
Description: disable receive CRC (for debug)

Name: BRD_RADIO_SIGCH
Description: Channel to show receive RSSI signal strength, or zero for disabled

Name: BRD_RADIO_PPSCH
Description: Channel to show received packet-per-second rate, or zero for disabled

Name: BRD_RADIO_TELEM
Description: If this is non-zero then telemetry packets will be sent over DSM

Name: BRD_RADIO_TXPOW
Description: Set telemetry transmit power. This is the power level (from 1 to 8) for telemetry packets sent from the RX to the TX

Name: BRD_RADIO_FCCTST
Description: If this is enabled then the radio will continuously transmit as required for FCC testing. The transmit channel is set by the value of the parameter. The radio will not work for RC input while this is enabled

Name: BRD_RADIO_STKMD
Description: This selects between different stick input modes. The default is mode2, which has throttle on the left stick and pitch on the right stick. You can instead set mode1, which has throttle on the right stick and pitch on the left stick.

Name: BRD_RADIO_TESTCH
Description: This sets the radio to a fixed test channel for factory testing. Using a fixed channel avoids the need for binding in factory testing.

Name: BRD_RADIO_TSIGCH
Description: Channel to show telemetry RSSI value as received by TX

Name: BRD_RADIO_TPPSCH
Description: Channel to show telemetry packets-per-second value, as received at TX

Name: BRD_RADIO_TXMAX
Description: Set transmitter maximum transmit power (from 1 to 8)

Name: BRD_RADIO_BZOFS
Description: Set transmitter buzzer note adjustment (adjust frequency up)

Name: BRD_RADIO_ABTIME
Description: When non-zero this sets the time with no transmitter packets before we start looking for auto-bind packets.

Name: BRD_RADIO_ABLVL
Description: This sets the minimum RSSI of an auto-bind packet for it to be accepted. This should be set so that auto-bind will only happen at short range to minimise the change of an auto-bind happening accidentially

Name: BRD_RTC_TYPES
Description: Specifies which sources of UTC time will be accepted

Name: BRD_RTC_TZ_MIN
Description: Adds offset in +- minutes from UTC to calculate local time

Name: BTN_ENABLE
Description: This enables the button checking module. When this is disabled the parameters for setting button inputs are not visible

Name: BTN_PIN1
Description: Digital pin number for first button input.

Name: BTN_PIN2
Description: Digital pin number for second button input.

Name: BTN_PIN3
Description: Digital pin number for third button input.

Name: BTN_PIN4
Description: Digital pin number for fourth button input.

Name: BTN_REPORT_SEND
Description: The duration in seconds that a BUTTON_CHANGE report is repeatedly sent to the GCS regarding a button changing state. Note that the BUTTON_CHANGE message is MAVLink2 only.

Name: BTN_OPTIONS1
Description: Options for Pin 1. PWM input detects PWM above or below 1800/1200us instead of logic level. If PWM is not detected or is less than 800us or above 2200us the button will interpreted as low. Invert changes HIGH state to be logic low voltage on pin, or below 1200us, if PWM input.

Name: BTN_OPTIONS2
Description: Options for Pin 2. PWM input detects PWM above or below 1800/1200us instead of logic level. If PWM is not detected or is less than 800us or above 2200us the button will interpreted as low. Invert changes HIGH state to be logic low voltage on pin, or below 1200us, if PWM input.

Name: BTN_OPTIONS3
Description: Options for Pin 3. PWM input detects PWM above or below 1800/1200us instead of logic level. If PWM is not detected or is less than 800us or above 2200us the button will interpreted as low. Invert changes HIGH state to be logic low voltage on pin, or below 1200us, if PWM input.

Name: BTN_OPTIONS4
Description: Options for Pin 4. PWM input detects PWM above or below 1800/1200us instead of logic level. If PWM is not detected or is less than 800us or above 2200us the button will interpreted as low. Invert changes HIGH state to be logic low voltage on pin, or below 1200us, if PWM input.

Name: BTN_FUNC1
Description: Auxiliary RC Options function executed on pin change

Name: BTN_FUNC2
Description: Auxiliary RC Options function executed on pin change

Name: BTN_FUNC3
Description: Auxiliary RC Options function executed on pin change

Name: BTN_FUNC4
Description: Auxiliary RC Options function executed on pin change

Name: CAM_TRIGG_TYPE
Description: how to trigger the camera to take a picture

Name: CAM_DURATION
Description: How long the shutter will be held open in 10ths of a second (i.e. enter 10 for 1second, 50 for 5seconds)

Name: CAM_SERVO_ON
Description: PWM value in microseconds to move servo to when shutter is activated

Name: CAM_SERVO_OFF
Description: PWM value in microseconds to move servo to when shutter is deactivated

Name: CAM_TRIGG_DIST
Description: Distance in meters between camera triggers. If this value is non-zero then the camera will trigger whenever the position changes by this number of meters regardless of what mode the APM is in. Note that this parameter can also be set in an auto mission using the DO_SET_CAM_TRIGG_DIST command, allowing you to enable/disable the triggering of the camera during the flight.

Name: CAM_RELAY_ON
Description: This sets whether the relay goes high or low when it triggers. Note that you should also set RELAY_DEFAULT appropriately for your camera

Name: CAM_MIN_INTERVAL
Description: Postpone shooting if previous picture was taken less than preset time(ms) ago.

Name: CAM_MAX_ROLL
Description: Postpone shooting if roll is greater than limit. (0=Disable, will shoot regardless of roll).

Name: CAM_FEEDBACK_PIN
Description: pin number to use for save accurate camera feedback messages. If set to -1 then don't use a pin flag for this, otherwise this is a pin number which if held high after a picture trigger order, will save camera messages when camera really takes a picture. A universal camera hot shoe is needed. The pin should be held high for at least 2 milliseconds for reliable trigger detection. See also the CAM_FEEDBACK_POL option.

Name: CAM_FEEDBACK_POL
Description: Polarity for feedback pin. If this is 1 then the feedback pin should go high on trigger. If set to 0 then it should go low

Name: CAM_AUTO_ONLY
Description: When enabled, trigging by distance is done in AUTO mode only.

Name: CAM_TYPE
Description: Set the camera type that is being used, certain cameras have custom functions that need further configuration, this enables that.

Name: CAM_RC_TYPE
Description: RunCam deviee type used to determine OSD menu structure and shutter options.

Name: CAM_RC_FEATURES
Description: The available features of the attached RunCam device. If 0 then the RunCam device will be queried for the features it supports, otherwise this setting is used.

Name: CAM_RC_BT_DELAY
Description: Time it takes for the RunCam to become fully ready in ms. If this is too short then commands can get out of sync.

Name: CAM_RC_BTN_DELAY
Description: Time it takes for the a RunCam button press to be actived in ms. If this is too short then commands can get out of sync.

Name: CAM_RC_MDE_DELAY
Description: Time it takes for the a RunCam mode button press to be actived in ms. If a mode change first requires a video recording change then double this value is used. If this is too short then commands can get out of sync.

Name: CAM_RC_CONTROL
Description: Specifies the allowed actions required to enter the OSD menu

Name: CAN_LOGLEVEL
Description: Loglevel for recording initialisation and debug information from CAN Interface

Name: CAN_D1_PROTOCOL
Description: Enabling this option starts selected protocol that will use this virtual driver

Name: CAN_D1_KDE_NPOLE
Description: Sets the number of motor poles to calculate the correct RPM value

Name: CAN_D1_PC_ESC_BM
Description: Bitmask defining which ESC (motor) channels are to be transmitted over Piccolo CAN

Name: CAN_D1_PC_ESC_RT
Description: Output rate of ESC command messages

Name: CAN_D1_PC_SRV_BM
Description: Bitmask defining which servo channels are to be transmitted over Piccolo CAN

Name: CAN_D1_PC_SRV_RT
Description: Output rate of servo command messages

Name: CAN_D1_TST_ID
Description: Selects the Index of Test that needs to be run recursively, this value gets reset to 0 at boot.

Name: CAN_D1_TST_LPR8
Description: Selects the Looprate of Test methods

Name: CAN_D1_UC_NODE
Description: UAVCAN node should be set implicitly

Name: CAN_D1_UC_SRV_BM
Description: Bitmask with one set for channel to be transmitted as a servo command over UAVCAN

Name: CAN_D1_UC_ESC_BM
Description: Bitmask with one set for channel to be transmitted as a ESC command over UAVCAN

Name: CAN_D1_UC_SRV_RT
Description: Maximum transmit rate for servo outputs

Name: CAN_D1_UC_OPTION
Description: Option flags

Name: CAN_D1_UC_NTF_RT
Description: Maximum transmit rate for Notify State Message

Name: CAN_D2_PROTOCOL
Description: Enabling this option starts selected protocol that will use this virtual driver

Name: CAN_D2_KDE_NPOLE
Description: Sets the number of motor poles to calculate the correct RPM value

Name: CAN_D2_PC_ESC_BM
Description: Bitmask defining which ESC (motor) channels are to be transmitted over Piccolo CAN

Name: CAN_D2_PC_ESC_RT
Description: Output rate of ESC command messages

Name: CAN_D2_PC_SRV_BM
Description: Bitmask defining which servo channels are to be transmitted over Piccolo CAN

Name: CAN_D2_PC_SRV_RT
Description: Output rate of servo command messages

Name: CAN_D2_TST_ID
Description: Selects the Index of Test that needs to be run recursively, this value gets reset to 0 at boot.

Name: CAN_D2_TST_LPR8
Description: Selects the Looprate of Test methods

Name: CAN_D2_UC_NODE
Description: UAVCAN node should be set implicitly

Name: CAN_D2_UC_SRV_BM
Description: Bitmask with one set for channel to be transmitted as a servo command over UAVCAN

Name: CAN_D2_UC_ESC_BM
Description: Bitmask with one set for channel to be transmitted as a ESC command over UAVCAN

Name: CAN_D2_UC_SRV_RT
Description: Maximum transmit rate for servo outputs

Name: CAN_D2_UC_OPTION
Description: Option flags

Name: CAN_D2_UC_NTF_RT
Description: Maximum transmit rate for Notify State Message

Name: CAN_D3_PROTOCOL
Description: Enabling this option starts selected protocol that will use this virtual driver

Name: CAN_D3_KDE_NPOLE
Description: Sets the number of motor poles to calculate the correct RPM value

Name: CAN_D3_PC_ESC_BM
Description: Bitmask defining which ESC (motor) channels are to be transmitted over Piccolo CAN

Name: CAN_D3_PC_ESC_RT
Description: Output rate of ESC command messages

Name: CAN_D3_PC_SRV_BM
Description: Bitmask defining which servo channels are to be transmitted over Piccolo CAN

Name: CAN_D3_PC_SRV_RT
Description: Output rate of servo command messages

Name: CAN_D3_TST_ID
Description: Selects the Index of Test that needs to be run recursively, this value gets reset to 0 at boot.

Name: CAN_D3_TST_LPR8
Description: Selects the Looprate of Test methods

Name: CAN_D3_UC_NODE
Description: UAVCAN node should be set implicitly

Name: CAN_D3_UC_SRV_BM
Description: Bitmask with one set for channel to be transmitted as a servo command over UAVCAN

Name: CAN_D3_UC_ESC_BM
Description: Bitmask with one set for channel to be transmitted as a ESC command over UAVCAN

Name: CAN_D3_UC_SRV_RT
Description: Maximum transmit rate for servo outputs

Name: CAN_D3_UC_OPTION
Description: Option flags

Name: CAN_D3_UC_NTF_RT
Description: Maximum transmit rate for Notify State Message

Name: CAN_P1_DRIVER
Description: Enabling this option enables use of CAN buses.

Name: CAN_P1_BITRATE
Description: Bit rate can be set up to from 10000 to 1000000

Name: CAN_P1_FDBITRATE
Description: Bit rate can be set up to from 1000000 to 8000000

Name: CAN_P2_DRIVER
Description: Enabling this option enables use of CAN buses.

Name: CAN_P2_BITRATE
Description: Bit rate can be set up to from 10000 to 1000000

Name: CAN_P2_FDBITRATE
Description: Bit rate can be set up to from 1000000 to 8000000

Name: CAN_P3_DRIVER
Description: Enabling this option enables use of CAN buses.

Name: CAN_P3_BITRATE
Description: Bit rate can be set up to from 10000 to 1000000

Name: CAN_P3_FDBITRATE
Description: Bit rate can be set up to from 1000000 to 8000000

Name: CAN_SLCAN_CPORT
Description: CAN Interface ID to be routed to SLCAN, 0 means no routing

Name: CAN_SLCAN_SERNUM
Description: Serial Port ID to be used for temporary SLCAN iface, -1 means no temporary serial. This parameter is automatically reset on reboot or on timeout. See CAN_SLCAN_TIMOUT for timeout details

Name: CAN_SLCAN_TIMOUT
Description: Duration of inactivity after which SLCAN is switched back to original driver in seconds.

Name: CAN_SLCAN_SDELAY
Description: Duration after which slcan starts after setting SERNUM in seconds.

Name: CHUTE_ENABLED
Description: Parachute release enabled or disabled

Name: CHUTE_TYPE
Description: Parachute release mechanism type (relay or servo)

Name: CHUTE_SERVO_ON
Description: Parachute Servo PWM value in microseconds when parachute is released

Name: CHUTE_SERVO_OFF
Description: Parachute Servo PWM value in microseconds when parachute is not released

Name: CHUTE_ALT_MIN
Description: Parachute min altitude above home.  Parachute will not be released below this altitude.  0 to disable alt check.

Name: CHUTE_DELAY_MS
Description: Delay in millseconds between motor stop and chute release

Name: CHUTE_CRT_SINK
Description: Release parachute when critical sink rate is reached

Name: CHUTE_OPTIONS
Description: Optional behaviour for parachute

Name: CIRCLE_RADIUS
Description: Defines the radius of the circle the vehicle will fly when in Circle flight mode

Name: CIRCLE_RATE
Description: Circle mode's turn rate in deg/sec.  Positive to turn clockwise, negative for counter clockwise

Name: CIRCLE_OPTIONS
Description: 0:Enable or disable using the pitch/roll stick control circle mode's radius and rate

Name: COMPASS_OFS_X
Description: Offset to be added to the compass x-axis values to compensate for metal in the frame

Name: COMPASS_OFS_Y
Description: Offset to be added to the compass y-axis values to compensate for metal in the frame

Name: COMPASS_OFS_Z
Description: Offset to be added to the compass z-axis values to compensate for metal in the frame

Name: COMPASS_DEC
Description: An angle to compensate between the true north and magnetic north

Name: COMPASS_LEARN
Description: Enable or disable the automatic learning of compass offsets. You can enable learning either using a compass-only method that is suitable only for fixed wing aircraft or using the offsets learnt by the active EKF state estimator. If this option is enabled then the learnt offsets are saved when you disarm the vehicle. If InFlight learning is enabled then the compass with automatically start learning once a flight starts (must be armed). While InFlight learning is running you cannot use position control modes.

Name: COMPASS_USE
Description: Enable or disable the use of the compass (instead of the GPS) for determining heading

Name: COMPASS_AUTODEC
Description: Enable or disable the automatic calculation of the declination based on gps location

Name: COMPASS_MOTCT
Description: Set motor interference compensation type to disabled, throttle or current.  Do not change manually.

Name: COMPASS_MOT_X
Description: Multiplied by the current throttle and added to the compass's x-axis values to compensate for motor interference (Offset per Amp or at Full Throttle)

Name: COMPASS_MOT_Y
Description: Multiplied by the current throttle and added to the compass's y-axis values to compensate for motor interference (Offset per Amp or at Full Throttle)

Name: COMPASS_MOT_Z
Description: Multiplied by the current throttle and added to the compass's z-axis values to compensate for motor interference (Offset per Amp or at Full Throttle)

Name: COMPASS_ORIENT
Description: The orientation of the first external compass relative to the vehicle frame. This value will be ignored unless this compass is set as an external compass. When set correctly in the northern hemisphere, pointing the nose and right side down should increase the MagX and MagY values respectively. Rolling the vehicle upside down should decrease the MagZ value. For southern hemisphere, switch increase and decrease. NOTE: For internal compasses, AHRS_ORIENT is used. The label for each option is specified in the order of rotations for that orientation.

Name: COMPASS_EXTERNAL
Description: Configure compass so it is attached externally. This is auto-detected on most boards. Set to 1 if the compass is externally connected. When externally connected the COMPASS_ORIENT option operates independently of the AHRS_ORIENTATION board orientation option. If set to 0 or 1 then auto-detection by bus connection can override the value. If set to 2 then auto-detection will be disabled.

Name: COMPASS_OFS2_X
Description: Offset to be added to compass2's x-axis values to compensate for metal in the frame

Name: COMPASS_OFS2_Y
Description: Offset to be added to compass2's y-axis values to compensate for metal in the frame

Name: COMPASS_OFS2_Z
Description: Offset to be added to compass2's z-axis values to compensate for metal in the frame

Name: COMPASS_MOT2_X
Description: Multiplied by the current throttle and added to compass2's x-axis values to compensate for motor interference (Offset per Amp or at Full Throttle)

Name: COMPASS_MOT2_Y
Description: Multiplied by the current throttle and added to compass2's y-axis values to compensate for motor interference (Offset per Amp or at Full Throttle)

Name: COMPASS_MOT2_Z
Description: Multiplied by the current throttle and added to compass2's z-axis values to compensate for motor interference (Offset per Amp or at Full Throttle)

Name: COMPASS_OFS3_X
Description: Offset to be added to compass3's x-axis values to compensate for metal in the frame

Name: COMPASS_OFS3_Y
Description: Offset to be added to compass3's y-axis values to compensate for metal in the frame

Name: COMPASS_OFS3_Z
Description: Offset to be added to compass3's z-axis values to compensate for metal in the frame

Name: COMPASS_MOT3_X
Description: Multiplied by the current throttle and added to compass3's x-axis values to compensate for motor interference (Offset per Amp or at Full Throttle)

Name: COMPASS_MOT3_Y
Description: Multiplied by the current throttle and added to compass3's y-axis values to compensate for motor interference (Offset per Amp or at Full Throttle)

Name: COMPASS_MOT3_Z
