Name: SERVO_BLH_MASK
Description: Enable of BLHeli pass-thru servo protocol support to specific channels. This mask is in addition to motors enabled using SERVO_BLH_AUTO (if any)

Name: SERVO_BLH_AUTO
Description: If set to 1 this auto-enables BLHeli pass-thru support for all multicopter motors

Name: SERVO_BLH_TEST
Description: Setting SERVO_BLH_TEST to a motor number enables an internal test of the BLHeli ESC protocol to the corresponding ESC. The debug output is displayed on the USB console.

Name: SERVO_BLH_TMOUT
Description: This sets the inactivity timeout for the BLHeli protocol in seconds. If no packets are received in this time normal MAVLink operations are resumed. A value of 0 means no timeout

Name: SERVO_BLH_TRATE
Description: This sets the rate in Hz for requesting telemetry from ESCs. It is the rate per ESC. Setting to zero disables telemetry requests

Name: SERVO_BLH_DEBUG
Description: When set to 1 this enabled verbose debugging output over MAVLink when the blheli protocol is active. This can be used to diagnose failures.

Name: SERVO_BLH_OTYPE
Description: When set to a non-zero value this overrides the output type for the output channels given by SERVO_BLH_MASK. This can be used to enable DShot on outputs that are not part of the multicopter motors group.

Name: SERVO_BLH_PORT
Description: This sets the mavlink channel to use for blheli pass-thru. The channel number is determined by the number of serial ports configured to use mavlink. So 0 is always the console, 1 is the next serial port using mavlink, 2 the next after that and so on.

Name: SERVO_BLH_POLES
Description: This allows calculation of true RPM from ESC's eRPM. The default is 14.

Name: SERVO_BLH_3DMASK
Description: Mask of channels which are dynamically reversible. This is used to configure ESCs in '3D' mode, allowing for the motor to spin in either direction

Name: SERVO_BLH_BDMASK
Description: Mask of channels which support bi-directional dshot. This is used for ESCs which have firmware that supports bi-directional dshot allowing fast rpm telemetry values to be returned for the harmonic notch.

Name: SERVO_BLH_RVMASK
Description: Mask of channels which are reversed. This is used to configure ESCs in reversed mode

Name: SERVO_FTW_MASK
Description: Servo channel mask specifying FETtec ESC output.

Name: SERVO_FTW_RVMASK
Description: Servo channel mask to reverse rotation of FETtec ESC outputs.

Name: SERVO_FTW_POLES
Description: Number of motor electrical poles

Name: SERVO_ROB_POSMIN
Description: Position minimum at servo min value. This should be within the position control range of the servos, normally 0 to 4095

Name: SERVO_ROB_POSMAX
Description: Position maximum at servo max value. This should be within the position control range of the servos, normally 0 to 4095

Name: SERVO_SBUS_RATE
Description: This sets the SBUS output frame rate in Hz.

Name: SERVO_VOLZ_MASK
Description: Enable of volz servo protocol to specific channels

Name: SID_AXIS
Description: Controls which axis are being excited.  Set to non-zero to see more parameters

Name: SID_MAGNITUDE
Description: Magnitude of sweep in deg, deg/s and 0-1 for mixer outputs.

Name: SID_F_START_HZ
Description: Frequency at the start of the sweep

Name: SID_F_STOP_HZ
Description: Frequency at the end of the sweep

Name: SID_T_FADE_IN
Description: Time to reach maximum amplitude of sweep

Name: SID_T_REC
Description: Time taken to complete the sweep

Name: SID_T_FADE_OUT
Description: Time to reach zero amplitude at the end of the sweep

Name: SPRAY_ENABLE
Description: Allows you to enable (1) or disable (0) the sprayer

Name: SPRAY_PUMP_RATE
Description: Desired pump speed when traveling 1m/s expressed as a percentage

Name: SPRAY_SPINNER
Description: Spinner's rotation speed in PWM (a higher rate will disperse the spray over a wider area horizontally)

Name: SPRAY_SPEED_MIN
Description: Speed minimum at which we will begin spraying

Name: SPRAY_PUMP_MIN
Description: Minimum pump speed expressed as a percentage

Name: SR0_RAW_SENS
Description: Stream rate of RAW_IMU, SCALED_IMU2, SCALED_IMU3, SCALED_PRESSURE, SCALED_PRESSURE2, SCALED_PRESSURE3 and SENSOR_OFFSETS to ground station

Name: SR0_EXT_STAT
Description: Stream rate of SYS_STATUS, POWER_STATUS, MCU_STATUS, MEMINFO, CURRENT_WAYPOINT, GPS_RAW_INT, GPS_RTK (if available), GPS2_RAW (if available), GPS2_RTK (if available), NAV_CONTROLLER_OUTPUT, and FENCE_STATUS to ground station

Name: SR0_RC_CHAN
Description: Stream rate of SERVO_OUTPUT_RAW and RC_CHANNELS to ground station

Name: SR0_RAW_CTRL
Description: Unused

Name: SR0_POSITION
Description: Stream rate of GLOBAL_POSITION_INT and LOCAL_POSITION_NED to ground station

Name: SR0_EXTRA1
Description: Stream rate of ATTITUDE, SIMSTATE (SIM only), AHRS2 and PID_TUNING to ground station

Name: SR0_EXTRA2
Description: Stream rate of VFR_HUD to ground station

Name: SR0_EXTRA3
Description: Stream rate of AHRS, HWSTATUS, SYSTEM_TIME, RANGEFINDER, DISTANCE_SENSOR, TERRAIN_REQUEST, BATTERY2, MOUNT_STATUS, OPTICAL_FLOW, GIMBAL_REPORT, MAG_CAL_REPORT, MAG_CAL_PROGRESS, EKF_STATUS_REPORT, VIBRATION and RPM to ground station

Name: SR0_PARAMS
Description: Stream rate of PARAM_VALUE to ground station

Name: SR0_ADSB
Description: ADSB stream rate to ground station

Name: SRTL_ACCURACY
Description: SmartRTL accuracy. The minimum distance between points.

Name: SRTL_POINTS
Description: SmartRTL maximum number of points on path. Set to 0 to disable SmartRTL.  100 points consumes about 3k of memory.

Name: SRTL_OPTIONS
Description: Bitmask of SmartRTL options.

Name: STAT_BOOTCNT
Description: Number of times board has been booted

Name: STAT_FLTTIME
Description: Total FlightTime (seconds)

Name: STAT_RUNTIME
Description: Total time autopilot has run

Name: STAT_RESET
Description: Seconds since January 1st 2016 (Unix epoch+1451606400) since statistics reset (set to 0 to reset statistics)

Name: TCAL_ENABLED
Description: Enable temperature calibration. Set to 0 to disable. Set to 1 to use learned values. Set to 2 to learn new values and use the values

Name: TCAL_TEMP_MIN
Description: Minimum learned temperature. This is automatically set by the learning process

Name: TCAL_TEMP_MAX
Description: Maximum learned temperature. This is automatically set by the learning process

Name: TCAL_BARO_EXP
Description: Learned exponent for barometer temperature correction

Name: TERRAIN_ENABLE
Description: enable terrain data. This enables the vehicle storing a database of terrain data on the SD card. The terrain data is requested from the ground station as needed, and stored for later use on the SD card. To be useful the ground station must support TERRAIN_REQUEST messages and have access to a terrain database, such as the SRTM database.

Name: TERRAIN_SPACING
Description: Distance between terrain grid points in meters. This controls the horizontal resolution of the terrain data that is stored on te SD card and requested from the ground station. If your GCS is using the ArduPilot SRTM database like Mission Planner or MAVProxy, then a resolution of 100 meters is appropriate. Grid spacings lower than 100 meters waste SD card space if the GCS cannot provide that resolution. The grid spacing also controls how much data is kept in memory during flight. A larger grid spacing will allow for a larger amount of data in memory. A grid spacing of 100 meters results in the vehicle keeping 12 grid squares in memory with each grid square having a size of 2.7 kilometers by 3.2 kilometers. Any additional grid squares are stored on the SD once they are fetched from the GCS and will be loaded as needed.

Name: TERRAIN_OPTIONS
Description: Options to change behaviour of terrain system

Name: TERRAIN_MARGIN
Description: Margin in centi-meters to accept terrain data from the GCS. This can be used to allow older terrain data generated with less accurate latitude/longitude scaling to be used

Name: TERRAIN_OFS_MAX
Description: The maximum adjustment of terrain altitude based on the assumption that the vehicle is on the ground when it is armed. When the vehicle is armed the location of the vehicle is recorded, and when terrain data is available for that location a height adjustment for terrain data is calculated that aligns the terrain height at that location with the altitude recorded at arming. This height adjustment is applied to all terrain data. This parameter clamps the amount of adjustment. A value of zero disables the use of terrain height adjustment.

Name: TMODE_ENABLE
Description: tmode (or "toy" mode) gives a simplified user interface designed for mass market drones. Version1 is for the SkyViper V2450GPS. Version2 is for the F412 based boards

Name: TMODE_MODE1
Description: This is the initial mode when the vehicle is first turned on. This mode is assumed to not require GPS

Name: TMODE_MODE2
Description: This is the secondary mode. This mode is assumed to require GPS

Name: TMODE_ACTION1
Description: This is the action taken when the left action button is pressed

Name: TMODE_ACTION2
Description: This is the action taken when the right action button is pressed

Name: TMODE_ACTION3
Description: This is the action taken when the power button is pressed

Name: TMODE_ACTION4
Description: This is the action taken when the left action button is pressed while the left (Mode) button is held down

Name: TMODE_ACTION5
Description: This is the action taken when the right action is pressed while the left (Mode) button is held down

Name: TMODE_ACTION6
Description: This is the action taken when the power button is pressed while the left (Mode) button is held down

Name: TMODE_LEFT
Description: This is the action taken when the left (Mode) button is pressed

Name: TMODE_LEFT_LONG
Description: This is the action taken when the left (Mode) button is long-pressed

Name: TMODE_TRIM_AUTO
Description: This is the amount of automatic stick trim that can be applied when disarmed with sticks not moving. It is a PWM limit value away from 1500

Name: TMODE_RIGHT
Description: This is the action taken when the right (Return) button is pressed

Name: TMODE_FLAGS
Description: Bitmask of flags to change the behaviour of tmode. DisarmOnLowThrottle means to disarm if throttle is held down for 1 second when landed. ArmOnHighThrottle means to arm if throttle is above 80% for 1 second. UpgradeToLoiter means to allow takeoff in LOITER mode by switching to ALT_HOLD, then auto-upgrading to LOITER once GPS is available. RTLStickCancel means that on large stick inputs in RTL mode that LOITER mode is engaged

Name: TMODE_VMIN
Description: This is the battery voltage below which no output limiting is done

Name: TMODE_VMAX
Description: This is the battery voltage above which thrust min is used

Name: TMODE_TMIN
Description: This sets the thrust multiplier when voltage is high

Name: TMODE_TMAX
Description: This sets the thrust multiplier when voltage is low

Name: TMODE_LOAD_MUL
Description: This scales the load test output, as a value between 0 and 1

Name: TMODE_LOAD_FILT
Description: This filters the load test output. A value of 1 means no filter. 2 means values are repeated once. 3 means values are repeated 3 times, etc

Name: TMODE_LOAD_TYPE
Description: This sets the type of load test

Name: VISO_TYPE
Description: Visual odometry camera connection type

Name: VISO_POS_X
Description: X position of the camera in body frame. Positive X is forward of the origin.

Name: VISO_POS_Y
Description: Y position of the camera in body frame. Positive Y is to the right of the origin.

Name: VISO_POS_Z
Description: Z position of the camera in body frame. Positive Z is down from the origin.

Name: VISO_ORIENT
Description: Visual odometery camera orientation

Name: VISO_SCALE
Description: Visual odometry scaling factor applied to position estimates from sensor

Name: VISO_DELAY_MS
Description: Visual odometry sensor delay relative to inertial measurements

Name: VISO_VEL_M_NSE
Description: Visual odometry velocity measurement noise in m/s

Name: VISO_POS_M_NSE
Description: Visual odometry position measurement noise minimum (meters). This value will be used if the sensor provides a lower noise value (or no noise value)

Name: VISO_YAW_M_NSE
Description: Visual odometry yaw measurement noise minimum (radians), This value will be used if the sensor provides a lower noise value (or no noise value)

Name: VTX_ENABLE
Description: Toggles the Video Transmitter on and off

Name: VTX_POWER
Description: Video Transmitter Power Level. Different VTXs support different power levels, the power level chosen will be rounded down to the nearest supported power level

Name: VTX_CHANNEL
Description: Video Transmitter Channel

Name: VTX_BAND
Description: Video Transmitter Band

Name: VTX_FREQ
Description: Video Transmitter Frequency. The frequency is derived from the setting of BAND and CHANNEL

Name: VTX_OPTIONS
Description: Video Transmitter Options. Pitmode puts the VTX in a low power state. Unlocked enables certain restricted frequencies and power levels. Do not enable the Unlocked option unless you have appropriate permissions in your jurisdiction to transmit at high power levels.

Name: VTX_MAX_POWER
Description: Video Transmitter Maximum Power Level. Different VTXs support different power levels, this prevents the power aux switch from requesting too high a power level. The switch supports 6 power levels and the selected power will be a subdivision between 0 and this setting.

Name: WINCH_TYPE
Description: Winch Type

Name: WINCH_RATE_MAX
Description: Winch deploy or retract rate maximum.  Set to maximum rate with no load.

Name: WINCH_POS_P
Description: Winch control position error P gain

Name: WPNAV_SPEED
Description: Defines the speed in cm/s which the aircraft will attempt to maintain horizontally during a WP mission

Name: WPNAV_RADIUS
Description: Defines the distance from a waypoint, that when crossed indicates the wp has been hit.

Name: WPNAV_SPEED_UP
Description: Defines the speed in cm/s which the aircraft will attempt to maintain while climbing during a WP mission

Name: WPNAV_SPEED_DN
Description: Defines the speed in cm/s which the aircraft will attempt to maintain while descending during a WP mission

Name: WPNAV_ACCEL
Description: Defines the horizontal acceleration in cm/s/s used during missions

Name: WPNAV_ACCEL_Z
Description: Defines the vertical acceleration in cm/s/s used during missions

Name: WPNAV_RFND_USE
Description: This controls if waypoint missions use rangefinder for terrain following

Name: WPNAV_JERK
Description: Defines the horizontal jerk in m/s/s used during missions

Name: WPNAV_TER_MARGIN
Description: Waypoint Terrain following altitude margin.  Vehicle will stop if distance from target altitude is larger than this margin (in meters)

Name: ZIGZ_AUTO_ENABLE
Description: Allows you to enable (1) or disable (0) ZigZag auto feature

Name: ZIGZ_SPRAYER
Description: Enable the auto sprayer in ZigZag mode. SPRAY_ENABLE = 1 and SERVOx_FUNCTION = 22(SprayerPump) / 23(SprayerSpinner) also must be set. This makes the sprayer on while moving to destination A or B. The sprayer will stop if the vehicle reaches destination or the flight mode is changed from ZigZag to other.

Name: ZIGZ_WP_DELAY
Description: Waiting time after reached the destination

Name: ZIGZ_SIDE_DIST
Description: The distance to move sideways in ZigZag mode

Name: ZIGZ_DIRECTION
Description: The direction to move sideways in ZigZag mode

Name: ZIGZ_LINE_NUM
Description: Total number of lines for ZigZag auto if 1 or more. -1: Infinity, 0: Just moving to sideways
